sections.heading: Signs Marking Township Limits.
sections.text:
A township may manufacture and place signs marking the township limits along any state highway which passes through the township. The department of state highways shall provide specifications for the manufacture of the signs, and may supervise their construction. If a township shall erect such signs along any state highway, it shall thereafter maintain the same at the township's expense.

History:1972, Act 140, Eff. Mar. 30, 1973
